technology: There were no technical difficulties during the conversation.
cur_neg_affect: The participant expresses some negative affect regarding the current state of COVID, particularly about the removal of free testing and paid sick leave (13:07-13:38).
past_neg_affect: The participant describes significant fear and anxiety during the initial stages of the pandemic, especially when her son was sick (03:25-03:37, 12:36-12:43, 15:00-15:11), and after her son's dad got sick with COVID (06:25-06:49).
communal_orientation: The participant engages in the conversation, shares her experiences openly, and responds to the conversation partner's prompts, but doesn't go out of her way to build off of the conversation partner's story.
engagement: The participant is generally engaged in the conversation, sharing her experiences and answering questions, but doesn't actively try to extend the conversation beyond the prompts.
defensiveness: The participant does not exhibit any defensive behavior.

questions.transcript: Was there a certain vaccine you went for? Did you kind of research the particular one you wanted?
You mentioned that your son. Before kind of this was in March when he was super sick. And when COVID was first rolling out, wow.
But did he go to the hospital at all or was it just kind of left at home or?
How long how long was that last for? No.

similarity_statements.transcript: Yeah, well I was I was kind of silly. I was all scared of the vaccine. So I was I was afraid you know I was reading So I was really conflicted

vaccine_importance: The participant acknowledges the importance of the initial vaccine in the past, but is still afraid of it (07:33-07:40, 14:45-14:56).
booster_importance: The participant does not see boosters as important, given the current state of the pandemic (14:21-14:36).
cognitive_complexity: The participant demonstrates a moderate amount of cognitive complexity by considering different perspectives and acknowledging the changing nature of the pandemic and its impact on her decisions.
general_notes: The participant's fear and anxiety surrounding COVID and the vaccine are prominent themes throughout the conversation.
